scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-528 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-528 is a star with 1.01 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.06 times its radius. It is located 2557.81 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-528 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-528 system


Kepler-528 b

Kepler-528 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2016-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-528 b is 4.993 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-528 b is 2.080 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.04, and a semi-major axis of 0.1409 astronomical units, Kepler-528 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-528, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-528 - System With 1 Exoplanet
